content: this little cutie is much easier than it looks making it a great first-time amigurumi project this bunny is made in one piece with very minimal seaming and can be made in various sizes just by changing yarn and hook size its simple construction even allows you to work this up at a very small scale using fingering weight yarn and a tiny hook **this pattern is free when signing up for the creative crochet newsletter here 1 you can read about this pattern in my blog post over here 2 at the creative crochet corner ** **notes for rounds 10-14 you only need to work the 2 uncounted stitches to shift beginning of rounds to the center back after completing round 14- not at the end of each of these rnds also- when creating the gathering threads that form the head/ears from the rectangle you are not sewing anything together- you are merely making a gathering stitch line through one layer of fabric it is a running stitch that goes from center back at slit opening up to the center top of last row worked and then back down on the other side ending at the center back slit again ** finished measurements size varies according to yarn weight used honey-bunny measures approximately 4 75 long excluding tail when using worsted weight yarn 4 long for sport weight yarn and 2 5 long for fingering weight yarn materials approximately 60 yds worsted weight yarn or 55 yds of sport weight yarn or 40 yds fingering weight preferably wool or acrylic for body mc approximately 8 yds or less of white or light-colored yarn for tail pom-pom cc similar in weight/thickness to yarn used for head/body i used worsted weight yarn for the worsted weight and sport weight bunnies and sport weight for the fingering weight bunny us g 4 0mm crochet hook for worsted weight or size d 3 25mm crochet hook for sport weight or size b 2 25mm crochet hook for fingering weight or size needed to obtain gauge yarn needle removable stitch markers fiberfill or your preferred stuffing material 2 black safety eyes 8mm for worsted weight 6mm for sport weight or 5mm for fingering weight a small amount of pink or tan and black embroidery floss and embroidery needle to create nose/mouth small piece of cardboard for making pom-pom 1 5 4 cm wide for sport or worsted weight bunny or 1 2 5 cm for fingering weight bunny 1 https //go creativecrochetcorner com/a37176/ 2 https //www creativecrochetcorner
